Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.propertiesplus

Class PropertiesPlus

java.lang.Object
java.util.Dictionary<K,V>
java.util.Hashtable<Object,Object>
java.util.Properties
gov.sandia.gmp.util.propertiesplus.PropertiesPlus
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Map<Object,Object>
public class PropertiesPlus extends Properties implements Serializable

Title:

Extends java Properties with methods to retrieve values of type double, int, boolean, File, GeoVector, time and Date.

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2008

Company: Sandia National Laboratories

Version:
1.0
Author:
Sandy Ballard
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • load

      public void load(Reader reader)
      Override Properties.load(Reader) in order to be able to load file and path names with single backslashes instead of double backslashes.

      Super class Properties.load(Reader) considers a single backslash to be an escape character. This meant that in order to read a windows path name from a properties file you had to double up the backslashes, eg., to specify c:\dir\filename you add to actually put c:\\dir\\filename. This method overrides Property.load(Reader) and correctly interprets single backslashes.

      To provide backward compatibility with old GMP property files, two special cases are considered. If a value starts with 4 backslashes, or starts with a single character followed by ':\\', then all double backslashes are replaced with single backslashes.

      Overrides:
      load in class Properties

    • getProperty

      public String getProperty(String property)
      Calls super.getProperty with property.trim() and trims the result before returning.

      If the result contains substring <property:xxx> then <property:xxx> is replaced with the result of getProperty(xxx). For example, if the property file contains:
      rootDir = c:\\directory\\
      path = <property:rootDir>filename
      then calling getProperty("path") will return 'c:\\directory\\filename'

      If the result contains substring <env:xxx> then <env:xxx> is replaced with the result of System.getenv(xxx). For example, if the environment variable 'username' is defined then
      UserName = <env:username>
      will return the value of environment variable 'username'

      Overrides:
      getProperty in class Properties

    • getTime

      public double getTime(String property) throws PropertiesPlusException
      Retrieve the value of the specified property as time in seconds since January 1, 1970. If the string can be converted to an integer, it is interpreted to be a julian date in GMT time zone and returned. Otherwise, if the string can be converted to a double, it is interpreted as an epoch time (seconds since 1970) and returned. Otherwise, all '/' are replaced with '-' and an attempt is made to parse the string using any of:
      yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss.SSS Z
      yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss.SSS
      yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss Z
      yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss
      If Z is not specified, then the GMT timezone is assumed.
      Parameters:
      property - String
      Returns:
      double
      Throws:
      PropertiesPlusException

    • getTime

      public double getTime(String property, String defaultValue) throws PropertiesPlusException
      Retrieve the value of the specified property as time in milliseconds since January 1, 1970 GMT. If the value can be converted to a integer, then it is assumed to represent a jdate object (YYYYDDD). Otherwise, if the value can be converted to a double, then the value is assumed to represent epochtime (seconds since jan 1, 1970 GMT). Otherwise, if the property's value can be parsed as a Date object using formats yyyy/mm/dd hh:mm:ss or yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss or yyyy/mm/dd hh:mm:ss.SSS or yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss.SSS then the epochtime is extracted from the Date (the Date is assumed to reflect the GMT time zone). Otherwise, a PropertiesPlusException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      property - String
      defaultValue - double
      Returns:
      double
      Throws:
      PropertiesPlusException

    • getDate

      public Date getDate(String property) throws PropertiesPlusException
      Retrieve the value of the specified property as a Date object. If the value can be converted to a integer, then it is assumed to represent a jdate object (YYYYDDD) in the GMT time zone. Otherwise, if the value can be converted to a double, then the value is assumed to represent epochtime (seconds since Jan 1, 1970 GMT). Otherwise, if the property's value can be parsed as a Date object using formats yyyy/mm/dd hh:mm:ss or yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss or yyyy/mm/dd hh:mm:ss.SSS or yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss.SSS then the Date is returned (GMT time zone is assumed). Otherwise, a PropertiesPlusException is thrown.

      Returns null if property is not defined.

      Parameters:
      property - String
      Returns:
      Date
      Throws:
      PropertiesPlusException

    • getDate

      public Date getDate(String property, Date defaultValue) throws PropertiesPlusException
      Retrieve the value of the specified property as a Date object. If the value can be converted to a integer, then it is assumed to represent a jdate object (YYYYDDD) in the GMT time zone. Otherwise, if the value can be converted to a double, then the value is assumed to represent epochtime (seconds since Jan 1, 1970 GMT). Otherwise, if the property's value can be parsed as a Date object using formats yyyy/mm/dd hh:mm:ss or yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss or yyyy/mm/dd hh:mm:ss.SSS or yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss.SSS then the Date is returned (GMT time zone is assumed). Otherwise, a PropertiesPlusException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      property - String
      defaultValue - Date
      Returns:
      Date
      Throws:
      PropertiesPlusException

    • getFile

      public File getFile(String property) throws PropertiesPlusException
      Retrieve the value of the specified property as a File object. On all platforms except Windows, Windows path names are converted to Unix style path names. Most importantly, paths like "\\bikinifire.sandia.gov\index\devl\gmp\Runs\Test\MyOutputFile.txt" becomes "/index/devl/gmp/Runs/Test/MyOutputFile.txt"
      Parameters:
      property - String
      Returns:
      File
      Throws:
      PropertiesPlusException

    • getRequestedProperties

      public Map<String,LinkedHashSet<String>> getRequestedProperties()
      Retrieve a reference to the map of requested properties. These include only properties that have actually been requested. It includes requests that returned default values. Properties in the initial property file that were never requested are not included.
      Returns:
      LinkedHashMap<String, LinkedHashSet>

    • getRequestedPropertiesString

      public String getRequestedPropertiesString(boolean sortAlphabetically)
      Retrieve a String representation of all the requested properties.
      Parameters:
      sortAlphabetically - if true, requested properties are sorted alphabetically, otherwise requested properties are reported in the order in which they were requested.
      Returns:
      requested properties

    • getPropertyPath

      public String getPropertyPath(String property, String defaultValue)
      Retrieve the value of the specified property as a String. It is assumed to be a file path that will be converted to its OS-specific format.
      Parameters:
      property - String
      Returns:
      File
      Throws:
      PropertiesPlusException

    • convertWinFilePathToLinux

      public static String convertWinFilePathToLinux(String inputFilePath)
      Convert file path from Windows to Linux/Unix only if native OS is non-Windows. Example: \\ server.sandia.gov\actualFilePath If the native OS is not Windows, this function will prepend "nfs", keep only the lowest level domain part of the server name ("server" in "server.sandia.gov"), keep "actualFilePath" and convert all "\" into "/". In the above example, the output would be: /nfs/server/actualFilePath. NOTE: IP addresses are NOT supported! NOTE: There is a special case for thummper; the "GNEM" subpath is stripped out: Example input: \\thummper.sandia.gov\GNEM\indexpool\devl\gmp Example output: /nfs/thummper/indexpool/devl/gmp
      Parameters:
      inputFilePath - - Windows file path to convert, if necessary

    • getPropertyFile

      public File getPropertyFile()
      If this PropertiesPlusGMP object was constructed with a File argument, they this method returns a reference to the File object. Otherwise returns null.
      Returns:
      the propertyFile
